title: Hyper Link Injection In email and Space Characters Allowed at Password Field.

profile.name: Phabricator
profile.about: Phabricator is a collection of open source web applications that help software companies build better software.

vulnerability_information:
Hello mongoose ,

I found that when you put email and password for signup, you can use space characters for the password which shouldn't be allowed. I also found that you can use hyperlink in First Name Field at next step when you are entering your personal information here and when you will get the first email of Welcome or a forget password request email hyperlink will be there at the Place of First name.

Prof Of Concept:
-----------------
* Sign Up [Here](https://admin.phacility.com/auth/register/)
* In the username Field type "www.yoursite.com" and Fill the Rest of the Form like Email and etc.
* In the Password Field type 8 Space Bars which means 8 space characters.
* Click Register.
* You will now receive a email to confirm your email which will have the Hyper Link "www.yoursite.com".

What can Hacker Do?
-----------------------

Now with the above bugs a hacker could create a profile using victim's Email and put a link to his phishing site at the first name and he create a account and there will be a email sent to victim's email id using your system. Victim will open your email as it is from a trustful source and might click the phishing link.

A hacker can also Brute Force your password as it is very weak and fully takeover any user that have created an account using space characters.

Regards,
Ali Ashber

activities.message:
We do not consider phishing using usernames to represent a real threat. Attackers have very little control over the content of the email and it clearly contextualizes its intent.

There is no reason not to allow spaces in passwords, and spaces in passwords do not make passwords weaker (in fact, allowing more characters makes it easier to construct stronger passwords).

activities.message:
Ok, I can agree about the hyper Link Injection bug but I highly doubt about your reply for the space character bug. 
Look we type space character and there is no value of it. So it figuratively means that you haven't set any password in a valid sense. It is also very easy to guess and brute force.  Yes, you can allow space characters in between other characters in password but only the space characters in the password field shouldn't be allowed due to above said possibilities.

Regards,
Ali Ashber

activities.message:
Hello @epriestley ,

I hope you will reply.

There is a major difference between using the empty string (a string of length zero) and a string of only spaces as a password. We do not allow users to use the empty string.

We do allow users to use a string of the same character, including `__________` (ten spaces), `aaaaaaaaaa` (ten latin letter "a"s) or `üêà üêà üêà üêà üêà üêà üêà üêà üêà üêà` (ten cat emoji). These passwords are equivalent in their strength.

We can not prevent users from selecting weak passwords. We make reasonable efforts (including a minimum  password lengths and a blacklist of the most common user passwords) to encourage users to select better passwords, but it is ultimately their responsibility to select strong passwords.
